title: Allocate the credit line to Payment Portfolios

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: allocation_details
parameters.description: The details of credit line allocation. Max size: 10.

parameters.name: payment_portfolio_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Payment Portfolio. To obtain a list of Payment Portfolio IDs, use /payment_portfolio/get/ .

parameters.name: allocation_percentage
parameters.description: The percentage of credit line that you want to allocate to the Payment Portfolio, kept to four decimal places. Value range: 0-1. Note : The percentage you allocate to each Payment Portfolio must be greater than its used percentage. To confirm the used credit line percentage for a Payment Portfolio, check the min_allocation_percentage returned from /payment_portfolio/get/ . If your total credit line changes later, the credit line for each Portfolio will change based on the set percentage. Each Portfolio's available credit line is automatically restored when outstanding bills are settled. You won't need to manually reallocate the amount.
